input.content: Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your task is to select the option that is closest to the correct answer. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following is typically not included in the inquiry letter sent to the client's attorneys? A. An evaluation of the likelihood of an unfavorable outcome. B. A disclaimer regarding the likelihood of settlement of pending litigation. C. An estimate of the range of potential loss. D. A listing of pending or threatened litigation, claims, or assessments. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your task is to choose the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question, select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following reporting options is appropriate when the client declines to provide written representations to auditors? A. Qualified opinion or disclaimer of opinion. B. Unmodified or qualified opinion. C. Qualified or adverse opinion. D. Disclaimer of opinion or adverse opinion. For each question, select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your task is to choose the closest option to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. No explanation is needed. Do not include the number in your response.

When auditors conclude that a material and pervasive departure from GAAP exists in an entity's financial statements, which of the following phrases would most likely be included in their report? A. 'Do not present fairly in all material respects.' B. 'As a result of the departures discussed in the following paragraph.' C. 'We were engaged to audit the accompanying financial statements.' D. 'Except for the effects of the departure from generally accepted accounting principles, as discussed in the preceding paragraph.' For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Auditors must complete various phases of an audit after the date of the financial statements. The auditors' responsibility for matters affecting the client extends from the date of the financial statements to the A. audit report release date. B. date of the auditors' report. C. delivery of the auditors' reports to the client. D. final review of the audit documentation. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Before the impact of adjusting entries proposed by auditors are included in the client's financial statements, the adjustments must be approved by the A. client's management. B. engagement partner. C. audit manager. D. engagement quality review partner. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

The type of sampling most frequently used by the auditors during their substantive procedures is referred to as: A. attributes sampling. B. account balance sampling. C. variables sampling. D. item sampling. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following steps in the sampling process is ordinarily performed last? A. Measure sample items. B. Evaluate the sample results. C. Determine the objective of sampling. D. Define the characteristic of interest. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

What agency has the ultimate authority in defining independence for public companies? A. The SEC B. The Department of Justice C. The AICPA D. The U.S. Congress For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

The SEC requires all of the following for revenue to be recognized except: A. persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists. B. delivery has occurred or services have been rendered. C. the seller's price to the buyer is fixed or determinable. D. cash is collected. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

The file that contains sales transactions that were initiated in the system but are not yet completed is the A. pending order master. B. sales detail. C. inventory master. D. credit check file. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Elm Tree Inc. has a December 31 year end. On October 15, the auditor evaluated and tested Elm Tree's internal control procedures over the sales recording process and finds the controls to be effective. At a minimum, the auditor's year-end procedures for testing internal control procedures must include: A. confirmations of year-end accounts that were examined on October 15. B. tests of compliance with internal control for a random sample of transactions throughout the audit period. C. tests the client's internal control procedures from October 15 through the year end. D. a comparison of the responses to the auditor's internal control questionnaire with a detailed flowchart of control procedures at year end. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Harris is auditing the financial statements of Cole Corp., an energy company. The FASB requires that these financial statements must be accompanied by supplementary mineral reserve information. If this required information is materially misstated, what type of report should Harris issue? A. Qualified opinion on the financial statements and mineral reserve information due to the misstatement. B. Unmodified opinion with an other-matter paragraph disclaiming an opinion on the mineral reserve information. C. Unmodified opinion on the financial statements with an other-matter paragraph expressing an adverse opinion on the mineral reserve information. D. Adverse opinion on the financial statements and mineral reserve information due to the misstatement. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

The auditors' report on the entity's financial statements included an additional paragraph disclosing a difference of opinion between the auditors and the entity for which the auditors believed an adjustment to the financial statements should be made. The opinion paragraph of the auditors' report should express a(n) A. qualified opinion citing a departure from generally accepted accounting principles. B. qualified opinion citing a scope limitation and lack of specific evidence. C. disclaimer of opinion. D. unmodified opinion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Charlie Company's comparative financial statements include the financial statements of the prior year that were audited by predecessor auditors whose report on those financial statements is not presented. If the predecessor's report was qualified, the successor auditors should: A. request the entity to reissue the predecessor's report on the prior-years' statements. B. indicate in their report the substantive reasons for the qualification issued by the predecessor auditors. C. issue an updated comparative report on the entity's financial statements, indicating the involvement of component auditors. D. express an opinion only on the current-year's financial statements and make no reference to the prior-years' financial statements or opinion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following substantive procedures would not ordinarily be used by auditors in evaluating the potential existence of subsequent events? A. Obtaining written representations. B. Performing cut-off testing near year end. C. Inquiring of officers and other client executives. D. Reviewing the latest interim financial statements. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

The assertion that auditors will probably emphasize in the revenue and collection cycle is: A. completeness. B. accuracy. C. classification. D. occurrence. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

An auditor who is unable to form an opinion on a new client's opening inventory balances may issue an unmodified opinion on the current year's: A. statement of changes in shareholders' equity only. B. statement of cash flows only. C. income statement only. D. balance sheet only. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Why is defining the population so important in a sampling application? A. To reduce sampling risk to the appropriate level. B. To allow the auditor to appropriately measure sample items. C. To ensure that the results appropriately represent the entire population. D. To permit the auditor to select the appropriate type of substantive procedure. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following statements best describes nonstatistical sampling? A. Nonstatistical sampling only selects very large dollar items for examination. B. Nonstatistical sampling should be used when the auditor selects a substantive audit approach. C. Nonstatistical sampling does not allow the auditor to measure the exposure to sampling risk. D. Nonstatistical sampling should be used only in situations in which the auditor anticipates issuing a qualified or adverse opinion on the client's financial statements. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

In which of the following situations would the use of sampling be most appropriate? A. The number of items comprising the population is smaller. B. The need for precise information is less important. C. The likelihood of selecting a representative sample is relatively low. D. The use of sampling would be appropriate in all of these situations. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Place the following steps in the sampling process in the order in which they are performed. 1 = Measure sample items, 2 = Select sample items, 3 = Define the population. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

For which of the following audit tests would an auditor most likely use attributes sampling? A. Inspecting purchase orders for proper approval by supervisors. B. Determining that all payables are recorded at year end. C. Making an independent estimate of recorded payroll expense. D. Selecting accounts receivable for confirmation of account balances. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Judgments about the frequency of control deviations that identify a particular control risk level are related to: A. Upper limit rate of deviation. B. Expected population deviation rate. C. Tolerable rate of deviation. D. Sample rate of deviation. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

According to the profession's ethical standards, an auditor would be considered independent in which of the following instances? A. The client owes the auditor fees for more than two years prior to the issuance of the audit report. B. The client is the only tenant in a commercial building owned by the auditor. C. The auditor is the officially appointed stock transfer agent of a client. D. The auditor's checking account that is fully insured by a federal agency is held at a client financial institution. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Which of the following statements is true concerning auditors' responsibilities during the audit? A. Auditors must plan the audit to gather sufficient competent evidence to guarantee the accuracy of the financial statements. B. Auditors are not liable unless they commit gross negligence or intentionally disregard generally accepted auditing standards. C. Auditors are strictly liable for failures to discover client fraud. D. Auditors must exercise the level of care, skill, and judgment expected of a reasonably prudent auditor under the circumstances. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

An auditor noted that client sales had increased 10 percent for the year. At the same time, cost of goods sold as a percentage of sales had decreased from 45 percent to 40 percent and year-end accounts receivable had increased by 8 percent. The auditor is most likely concerned about: A. unrecorded costs. B. fictitious sales. C. improper sales cut-off. D. improper credit approvals. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

For which of the following objectives would auditors be least likely to use analytical procedures near the end of the audit? A. Evaluating the adequacy of evidence gathered in response to unexpected relationships among account balances. B. Identifying unusual or unexpected account balances or relationships among account balances that were not previously identified during the audit. C. Obtaining evidence about assertions related to account balances or classes of transactions. D. Evaluating the adequacy of evidence gathered in response to unexpected account balances. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

'Bill and hold' refers to an arrangement where: A. sales are shipped but are not recorded. B. sales are recorded but are not shipped. C. sales are billed but not collected. D. inventory is held but not billed. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

After considering management's plans, an auditor concludes that there is substantial doubt about a client's ability to continue as a going concern for a reasonable period of time. The auditor's responsibility includes: A. indicating to the client's audit committee whether management's plans for dealing with the adverse effects of the financial difficulties can be effectively implemented. B. issuing a qualified or adverse opinion, depending upon materiality, due to the possible effects on the financial statements. C. disclaiming an opinion on the financial statements due to the indications of possible financial difficulties. D. considering the adequacy of disclosure about the client's possible inability to continue as a going concern. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.

Instructions: You will be presented with an audit question and four options A through D. Your role is to answer the question and select the option that is closest to your conclusion. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

Kerry CPA is the auditor for Sammy Corp. During the audit, Kerry discovers a material misstatement in Sammy's financial statements. Sammy's management tells Kerry that if the misstatement is corrected or if Kerry issues an opinion that indicates there is a material misstatement, Sammy Corp. will likely have to declare bankruptcy and thousands of employees will lose their jobs. Which of the following statements is true if the misstatement is not corrected and Kerry issues an unqualified opinion on Sammy's financial statements? A. Kerry is likely liable to third parties even if the third parties were aware of the fraud and did not rely on the opinion. B. Kerry is liable only to third parties in privity of contract. C. Kerry is liable only to known users of the financial statements. D. Kerry is likely liable to any person who suffered a loss as a result of the fraud. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'.
